fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Eaton is working in the area of Heavy Duty Vehicle CO2 regulations with Commission’s Editing Board and Transmission Expert Group to ensure that the regulatory framework and test procedures are consistent with advanced transmission technologies and accurately quantify their impact to CO2 emissions.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Working Group on Motor Vehicles#E01295#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1295#Not a member#C#Heavy Duty C02 editing board  Working Group
membership: CLEPA – European trade association of suppliers to the transportation industry
goals__remit: Eaton provides energy-efficient solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power more efficiently, safely and sustainably. Eaton has approximately 96,000 employees and sells products to customers in more than 175 countries.
